videos.title: Victoria Monet - Alright (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Alright" by Victoria Monét, directed by Dave Meyers, is a vibrant homage to Janet Jackson, featuring high-energy choreography and striking visuals. In the video, Monét channels Jackson's iconic style, wearing a black-and-white fedora and suit, and performing dynamic dance routines reminiscent of Jackson's 1990s and 2000s era. The video, choreographed by Sean Bankhead, showcases Monét's impressive dance skills and captures the essence of liberation and celebration. Made in collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Mia Barnes.
videos.additional_info:
Victoria Monet - Alright (2024)
The music video for "Alright" by Victoria Monét, directed by Dave Meyers, is a vibrant homage to Janet Jackson, featuring high-energy choreography and striking visuals. In the video, Monét channels Jackson's iconic style, wearing a black-and-white fedora and suit, and performing dynamic dance routines reminiscent of Jackson's 1990s and 2000s era. The video, choreographed by Sean Bankhead, showcases Monét's impressive dance skills and captures the essence of liberation and celebration. Made in collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Mia Barnes.
Technique - Choreo , Light Flash
Director - Dave Meyers
DOP - Scott Cunningham
Editor - Vinnie Hobbs
Colorist - Dante Pasquinelli

videos.title: Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Say Nothing" by Flume featuring MAY-A, directed by Michael Hili, offers a visually captivating and surreal experience. It includes psychedelic visuals, with Flume donning a bleach-blonde hairstyle and posing on motorcycles, while MAY-A is seen submerged in black sand. The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.
videos.additional_info:
Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)

This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.

videos.title: Ken Carson - Fighting My Demons (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Fighting My Demons" by Ken Carson, directed by Cole Bennett, was released in 2023 and features unique, glitchy visuals. The video presents a series of grainy, 3D footage that gives off the impression of being shot with night-vision goggles, offering a surreal viewing experience. It mainly showcases Ken Carson partying and performing his lyrics, creating a montage that aligns with the song's themes. The video's eerie and dark aesthetics were noted for drawing inspiration from the style of 1990s Japanese cinema, culminating in a profound, existential moment where Ken faces a haunting black void, adding depth and narrative to the visual experience.
videos.additional_info:
Ken Carson - Fighting My Demons (2023)
The music video for "Fighting My Demons" by Ken Carson, directed by Cole Bennett, was released in 2023 and features unique, glitchy visuals. The video presents a series of grainy, 3D footage that gives off the impression of being shot with night-vision goggles, offering a surreal viewing experience. It mainly showcases Ken Carson partying and performing his lyrics, creating a montage that aligns with the song's themes. The video's eerie and dark aesthetics were noted for drawing inspiration from the style of 1990s Japanese cinema, culminating in a profound, existential moment where Ken faces a haunting black void, adding depth and narrative to the visual experience.
Technique - Levitation , Light Flash , Light Void , Silhouette
Director - Cole Bennett
DOP - Franklin Ricart
Editor - Cole Bennett
Colorist - Loren White

videos.alt_text: Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold?
videos.title: Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold? (2020)
videos.additional_info:
Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold? (2020)
Delirium-induced fata morgana brings together two lone friends. Constantly trying to break through their bubbles, they seem stuck in ever repeating loops - Elderbrook's new video is a reminder of invisible everyday habbits and patterns that form our lives. Performers: Antonín Ničovský, Daniel Vitešník Director - Jára Moravec DoP - Filip Marek Executive Producer: Carla Mooney, Delwyn Mooney Producer - Mojaš Perović Edit: Katarina Gramatová Production Manager - Klára Plechsson 1AD - Kristýna Rousková 1AC - Jan “Hofajz” Hofmann 2AC - Richard Krejza Set dressing: Helena Liška, Václav Bejlek Props - Farid Beyzai, Martin Žerdík Ronin op. - Anton Endovshenko Drone op - Vojtěch Pollák Gaffer - Tomáš Volter Electrician - Roman Lety Jabůrek Costumes/MUP - Aneta Boháčová Catering - Lenka Egrtová Transport - Jan Salvet Production Company: Cardel Service Production Company: Bistro Films
Technique - Light Flash , Spotlight
Director - Jara Moravec
DOP

videos.title: Bree Runway - Just Like That (2024)
videos.description: The "Just Like That" music video by Bree Runway is a vibrant and high-energy visual feast that showcases her bold fashion choices and dynamic choreography. Set against a variety of colorful backdrops, the video emphasizes Bree's confident persona and eclectic style, further establishing her as a rising star in the music industry.

videos.title: Ken Carson - Fighting My Demons (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Fighting My Demons" by Ken Carson, directed by Cole Bennett, was released in 2023 and features unique, glitchy visuals. The video presents a series of grainy, 3D footage that gives off the impression of being shot with night-vision goggles, offering a surreal viewing experience. It mainly showcases Ken Carson partying and performing his lyrics, creating a montage that aligns with the song's themes. The video's eerie and dark aesthetics were noted for drawing inspiration from the style of 1990s Japanese cinema, culminating in a profound, existential moment where Ken faces a haunting black void, adding depth and narrative to the visual experience.

videos.title: Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Say Nothing" by Flume featuring MAY-A, directed by Michael Hili, offers a visually captivating and surreal experience. It includes psychedelic visuals, with Flume donning a bleach-blonde hairstyle and posing on motorcycles, while MAY-A is seen submerged in black sand. The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.
videos.additional_info:

The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.

videos.alt_text: Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold?
videos.title: Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold? (2020)
videos.additional_info:
Elderbrook - Why Do We Shake In The Cold? (2020)
Delirium-induced fata morgana brings together two lone friends. Constantly trying to break through their bubbles, they seem stuck in ever repeating loops - Elderbrook's new video is a reminder of invisible everyday habbits and patterns that form our lives. Performers: Antonín Ničovský, Daniel Vitešník Director - Jára Moravec DoP - Filip Marek Executive Producer: Carla Mooney, Delwyn Mooney Producer - Mojaš Perović Edit: Katarina Gramatová Production Manager - Klára Plechsson 1AD - Kristýna Rousková 1AC - Jan “Hofajz” Hofmann 2AC - Richard Krejza Set dressing: Helena Liška, Václav Bejlek Props - Farid Beyzai, Martin Žerdík Ronin op. - Anton Endovshenko Drone op - Vojtěch Pollák Gaffer - Tomáš Volter Electrician - Roman Lety Jabůrek Costumes/MUP - Aneta Boháčová Catering - Lenka Egrtová Transport - Jan Salvet Production Company: Cardel Service Production Company: Bistro Films

videos.title: Severance (2022)
videos.description: Mark leads a team of office workers whose memories have been surgically divided between their work and personal lives. When a mysterious colleague appears outside of work, it begins a journey to discover the truth about their jobs.

videos.title: ONHA - KODAK (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Kodak" by ONHA, directed by Nitram, showcases the artist moving through different lively and surreal environments that correspond to playlists on a girl's phone. In one standout scene, ONHA is turned into a basketball, remaining the focal point during a game. The video is praised for its ambitious concept and impressive visual effects, making it a visually captivating experience.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: Inter Alia (Short Film) (2023)
videos.description: A musician is given everything. Money, fame, & more...but sometimes our dreams are just nightmares. After you arrive to your success, what comes next? Can you still find who you are after losing yourself? Is any of this even real?
videos.additional_info:
Inter Alia (Short Film) (2023)
A musician is given everything. Money, fame, & more...but sometimes our dreams are just nightmares. After you arrive to your success, what comes next? Can you still find who you are after losing yourself? Is any of this even real?

videos.title: Bree Runway - Just Like That (2024)
videos.description: The "Just Like That" music video by Bree Runway is a vibrant and high-energy visual feast that showcases her bold fashion choices and dynamic choreography. Set against a variety of colorful backdrops, the video emphasizes Bree's confident persona and eclectic style, further establishing her as a rising star in the music industry.
